volumeInfo.title: In the Shadow of the Giant
volumeInfo.subtitle: The Making of Mexico's Central America Policy, 1876-1930
volumeInfo.description: "Thorough study of the endogenous and external factors that have shaped Mexico's dealings with the Central American republics. Asserts that Mexico's policy has reflected both its status as a 'middle power' between Central America and the United States, and its desire to assert a leadership role in the region"--Handbook of Latin American Studies, v. 58.

searchInfo.textSnippet: Asserts that Mexico's policy has reflected both its status as a 'middle power' between Central America and the United States, and its desire to assert a leadership role in the region"--Handbook of Latin American Studies, v. 58.
